title: Upload class: file_ext_tolower misleading or buggy
body:
The file_ext_tolower is documented as "If set to TRUE, the file extension will be forced to lower case"
For the upload data, the fields are documented as
file_name   Name of the file that was uploaded, including the filename extension
file_ext    Filename extension, period included
My expectation of this was that
1. file_name always contains file_ext at its end, since it says it includes "the filename extension"
2. therefore, by setting file_ext_tolower I can achieve that the file is stored with a lowercased extension.

It turns out that only the data element file_ext is lowercased, and no longer corresponds to the end of file_name, while file_name and the actual file stored retain the original (e.g. uppercase) extension.
I feel that the documentation is misleading (it implies that file_ext is a part of file_name, and therefore would also be lowercased by using this option) and also this behaviour is unhelpful, if I need the file with a lowercased extension, I cannot simply rename it afterwards without running into a risk of name conflict, which the Upload class was intended to protect me from by creating a unique name, but it does this with the uppercased extension. 
Example: person A uploads A1234.jpg, then person B uploads A1234.JPG, Upload class sees no need to adjust, but if I then rename A1234.JPG to A1234.jpg, I would overwrite the previous file, and thus I would have to add filename uniquify code in my application when Upload class was supposed to do this task for me.

If you want to retain the current behaviour, I suggest that you clarify the documentation for file_ext_tolower: "only the file_ext data element will be affected by this setting, not the file name used to store the uploaded file in. file_ext will no longer be identical to the extension included in file_name if you set this option."
Many thanks in advance for your consideration.
